node.title: Biden wants COVID vaccine IP protections waived amid concern over Omicron variant
node.description: US President Joe Biden calls on nations meeting at the World Trade Organization next week to agree to waive intellectual property protections for COVID-19 vaccines as a new coronavirus variant is detected.
node.content:
["US\u00a0President Joe Biden has called on nations meeting at the World Trade Organization next week to agree to waive intellectual property protections for COVID-19 vaccines in the wake of the discovery of the new Omicron COVID variant in South Africa.", "\"The news about this new variant should make it clearer than ever why this pandemic will not end until we have global vaccinations,\" Mr Biden said in a statement.", "\"This news today reiterates the importance of moving on this [waiving intellectual property protections] quickly.\"", "Mr Biden\u00a0confirmed restrictions on travellers from eight countries in southern Africa would be imposed.", "All 27 European Union member states and the United Kingdom also temporarily suspended travel to and from southern Africa.", "", "
Twenty-two COVID cases in South Africa have been linked to the \"concerning\" new variant.
", "\"We don't know a lot about the variant except that is of great concern,\" Mr Biden\u00a0told reporters.", "Mr Biden spoke to media in Nantucket, Massachusetts while spending time with family for Thanksgiving, saying the variant was of \"big concern\".", "He called on every American to \"be responsible and be vaccinated, from ages five years and up\".", "He also asked everyone\u00a0eligible for a COVID-19\u00a0booster shot to get one\u00a0\"immediately upon being eligible\".", "\"That is the minimum that everyone should be doing,\" he said.", "\"We always talk about whether this is about freedom. I think it's about responsibility.\"", "", "
Mr Biden said\u00a0everyone\u00a0eligible for a COVID-19\u00a0booster shot should\u00a0get one\u00a0immediately.(Reuters: Karen Pulfer Focht)
", "A World Health Organization panel named the variant Omicron\u00a0and classified it as a highly transmissible virus of concern, the same category that includes the Delta variant.\u00a0", "The White House did not give immediate details on the travel ban, except to say the restrictions would not apply to returning US\u00a0citizens or permanent residents, who would continue to be required to test negative before their travel.", "", "
What COVID-19 travel insurance doesn't cover you for(Emilia Terzon)
", "ABC/wires"]
